Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2011 11:10PM owlzrest wrote: Hi geiru2011, I had lumpectomy June 30 and re-excision and SNB on July 29.  Five days later I stated having painful skin area from above lumpectomy incision to arm pit area and under side of upper arm.  It feels like the skin is chafed, but there is no redness.  According to my BS it is the nerves regenerating after being disturbed by the surgery. It is driving me crazy.  No pain meds seem to help.  The only time I can get relief is with an ice pack.  I've read other posts that say it eventually goes away.  I hope sooner than later.  It has been the worst part of this journey so far.

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2011 09:48PM owlzrest wrote: Thanks linda, It has been 4 weeks and it is finally going away.  I go tomorrow for more lab work, bone scan and CT scan.  Also, should find out my Oncotype DX score.  Depending on the score, the cancer center is wanting me to participate in a clinical trial.  It seems as soon as you recover from one thing you have to go on to the next.   Just taking one day at a time.
